column2: This Position should analyze and suggest the cost benefit alternatives to the organization. Best methods to improve the margins and suggest optimal absorption methods       Responsibilities & Requirements       + Cost Accountant is responsible for recognition of POC revenue and ensure it is complying to Revenue policy and IndAs.     + This position is responsible for analyzing, monitoring / tracking and control the cost of product from bidding stage till Sales recognition and reporting of the reasons for variance in margins in advance to the management.     + This Position is responsible for analyzing low margin products and report the reasons for low margins. Suggest better alternative for improving the margins by thoroughly understanding the cost structure of the various components in the product.     + This Position is responsible for analyzing the BOM with required inventories and suggest usage of available inventories with some modifications by thoroughly understanding the various component requirement for the products we assemble.     + The Cost Accountant will be the primary owner of inventory and cost accounting for Coimbatore plant, supporting related cross-functional groups in Operations by reviewing / establishing costing process and procedures.       **Position Requirements:**       + Preparation of cost sheet and product wise profitability statement     + Monthly track of POC progress as per revenue policy and IndAs     + Analyze cost of product at various levels from bidding stage till sales is recognized and regular update to the management on the variances in margins on a timely manner     + Explore and analyze root causes for low margin products and propose process changes to improve margins     + Review the existing costing process and procedures, suggest for any changes. Establish new process in line with cost accounting rules and internal policy.     + Review of information provided by operations to be used as a base on Costs and Margins for Percentage-of-Completion and Point-in-Time projects     + Work cross-functionally with Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Planning, Project Management, and Engineering to complete all job responsibilities on a timely basis     + Continuous review and analysis of hourly rates, overheads, absorption levels and report the reasons, suggest improvements to reduce the variances.     + Analysis, comparison and reporting of material consumption and production hours against plan/forecast at overall products     + Contribute to process improvements regarding all aspects of production cost accounting and related reporting     + Ensure Low Cost Margin, Excess and Obsolete, Capitalization of Manufacturing Variances policies are met and their accruals are accounted properly and timely.     + Perform SOX controls assigned to area of responsibility     + Maintenance of Cost Records as per CAS & timely completion of Cost Audit.       **Preferences:**       + Preferably a Qualified Cost Accountant with minimum two years of post qualification experience at manufacturing Companies     + A semi qualified with 5+ years of relevant cost accounting experience at manufacturing companies     + Good knowledge of manufacturing processes and material flows as well as related order accounting systems and processes     + Analytical mindset, high affinity for numbers and willingness to work in detail with ability to work independently and solve complex costing issues     + Knowledge in Oracle is added advantage to the profile     + Sound Knowledge of MS office especially MS Excel & MS Power Point     + Good command on written, spoken English and presentation Skills       What we can offer you:       + Friendly multicultural environment and team events     + Career development and training opportunities
column11: Supply chain, Career development, Costing, Bidding, Project management, Analytical, Oracle, MS Office, Powerpoint, Monitoring

column2: Roles and Responsibilities   1. Monitor monthly Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) & analyse Gross Margin (GM) ratios. 2. Analyse resource/factory overhead absorption rate (under-utilisation/ over-utilisation), idle capacity, etc. 3. Generate monthly valuation of inventories from EBS and analyse slow moving inventory & propose strategy for liquidating the same to the top management. 4. Carry out variance analysis of Manufacturing SBU P&L vis--vis budget based on systems output. 5. Ensure that cost of materials is updated for existing/new items across inventory organization and that cost of FGs is periodically rolled up. 6. Monitor open POs/open standard job orders and initiate action for its closure periodically/monthly, respectively. 7. Ensure that R&D update  ECR and MCR in Bill of Material is done only after the existing inventory is fully consumed at plant locations. 8. Identify under-utilisation of labour resources, if any, on monthly basis, as the BOM contains resource cost at a pre-defined rate. The monthly production will help to know whether these resources are being used at 100% efficiency or not. Propose corrective action to SBU head. 9 Identify over-utilisation of material resources, if any, on monthly basis, as the BOM contains material consumption on a pre-defined basis. In the event of excess consumption the same needs to be brought to the attention of top management. This may be due to poor QC or poor quality of material procured from vendors. Propose corrective action to SBU head. 10. Facilitate IT/ERP implementation or process enhancement/automation projects for SBU. 11. Facilitate completion of internal, statutory & cost audit and resolve issues. 12. Evaluate inter-company transactions within the group from a Related Party transactions (transfer pricing) perspective. 13 Prepare and suggest Transfer Pricing of products for sale between subsidiaries, inter-se. 14. Arrange Transfer Pricing documents from India for operating subsidiaries in compliance with their respective local laws.  Desired Candidate Profile   Should have experience in manufacturing devices industries. Should be proficient in Product Costing.
column11: Cost Accounting, Variance Analysis, Cost audit, Manufacturing, Balance Sheet, Product costing

column2: 1. Costing of Product: This involves determining the total cost incurred in the production of a product. It includes direct costs (materials, labor) and indirect costs (overheads, utilities, etc.). Accurate product costing helps in setting competitive prices, understanding profitability, and making informed decisions about production processes. 2. Analysis and Reporting of Important MIS (Management Information System) at the Right Time: This involves analyzing financial data and generating reports to provide management with timely and relevant information for decision-making. These reports may include financial statements, budget variance analysis, cost-performance reports, and other key performance indicators (KPIs). 3. Highlighting Cost Increases: Identifying and communicating any increases in costs is crucial for cost control and maintaining profitability. By monitoring cost trends and analyzing variances, potential cost-saving opportunities can be identified, and corrective actions can be taken promptly. 4. Maximum Utilization of SAP CO System: SAP CO (Controlling) is an essential module in the SAP ERP system that supports various aspects of managerial accounting, including cost center accounting, internal orders, and profitability analysis. Maximizing the utilization of SAP CO involves effectively configuring and using the system to streamline costing processes, improve accuracy, and enhance decision support capabilities. 5. Getting Benefit: Ultimately, the goal of these tasks is to generate benefits for the organization. This could include cost savings, improved efficiency, better decision-making, and ultimately, enhanced profitability. In summary, this role involves managing various aspects of costing and financial analysis, utilizing tools like SAP CO to optimize processes, and providing timely and insightful information to support strategic decision-making within the organization.
column11: Costing, SAP CO, MIS, Management Information System, SAP CO System

column2: Costing and cost analysis         Standard Cost Development: maintain, coordinate, develop, and streamline processes for calculation of standard costs. Interact with ERP system, feeding budget information and parameter assumptions to system for rolling up unit costs.     Projected Costs: for a given product line, lead the cross-functional process of validating projected unit costs for new products and estimates.     Period Close Manufacturing Analysis: Leverage ERP system to calculate, review, and correct actual unit cost variances from standards. Utilize and develop delivery tools for variances for RM price and usage, labor and overhead, efficiency and spending and volume. Design and develop tools to deliver data and information to financial analysts, plants and business units.      Analyse costs on a regular basis, identify and correct discrepancies.     Perform Process Order analysis and identify costs loaded on inventory     Month end Inventory valuation, overheads absorption workings, cost runs etc.     Liaison with R& D team and provide costs for new products based on data maintained in the current system.     Provide cost inputs to commercial team as and when required.     Manage Received not invoiced report follow-up and resolution with operations / sourcing of aged items and Manufacturing orders closure timely.     Partner with plants to improve data integrity, analysis and build understanding of cost, margin, and value creating opportunities.     Utilize and understand the ERP system(s) and other relevant systems / databases                 Controlling, Planning & Analysis, Insight             Leveraging standard monthly reporting packs, ensure deep monthly operations and supply performance analysis and insight. Review with relevant site and regional management, ensure appropriate follow actions defined and implemented.     Proactively support month end close, with early warnings of issues or exceptions to trends, ensuring timely and compliant delivery.     Partner Production and Supply Management to prepare local forecasts and budgets     Provide expertise and analytical oversight to support Global Finance Services and FP&A to execute and continuously improve accounting, reporting, compliance processes (e.g. Manufacturing costs booked to right ledger, values & provisions, accruals, PO process etc.)     Build collaboration and confidence in Finance and Operations that the information is accurate, timely and consistent - and generated efficiently.                 Inventory management & variance analysis / control             In collaboration with global costing function, support financial control processes for:      Excess & obsolete inventory, Rework, Inventory counts, Inventory valuation (Raw Materials, Finished Goods and Work in Progress), Purchase price and Inventory variances         Provide analysis, insight & define/implement appropriate mitigations: maintain accurate book inventory, increase transparency, collaborate with S&OP and align to production cost analysis     Partner with Finance Services, Costing and other support functions as appropriate             Production and supply chain cost control & productivity planning             Drive transparency, process effectiveness & ensure clear accountabilities: control process, improved accounting & compliance, identify cost drivers.     Focus on key cost items with the objective of cost reduction by technology / production line, cost category and actions to deliver.     Transparent, accurate analysis and benchmarking: monthly review of actual expenses vs budget. For costs above budget establish mitigating actions or obtain appropriate approval for the overspend             Local GAAP and SOX compliance             Support finance manager in accounting for inventories as per local GAAP and successfully closing audit as per local laws     Compliance with SOX controls pertaining to costing, inventory valuation     Support on internal audits   .

column1: Supply Chain Sr.Executive / Asst Manager Controlling For mnc company
column2: Dear Candidate, We have URGENT OPENING FOR MANAGER FOR MNC Manufacturing company for Sr.Executive / Asst Manager Supply Chain Controlling  Location HINJEWADI PHASE 2 PICK UP DROP NOT AVAILABLE CTC 12L to 14L NEG SCM SUPPLY CHAIN .Executive / Asst Manager  Position Overview: We are seeking a highly skilled Sr.Executive / Asst Manager Controlling to oversee and manage the financial operations related to our supply chain activities. This role involves financial planning, analysis, and reporting to ensure efficient and cost-effective supply chain operations. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in financial management, controlling, and business partnering within the food and beverage industry. Key Responsibilities: Financial Planning and Analysis: Develop financial models for supply chain planning and decision-making. Analyze supply chain costs, identify cost-saving opportunities, and provide actionable in-sights. Prepare and present financial reports to senior management. Budgeting and Forecasting: Coordinate the annual budgeting process for supply chain operations. Monitor and forecast expenses, ensuring alignment with budgetary goals. Address variances between budgeted and actual expenses. Cost Management: Implement cost control measures to optimize expenditures. Analyze procurement, logistics, and production costs for improvement. Financial Reporting: Prepare and review financial statements related to supply chain operations. Ensure compliance with accounting standards and regulatory requirements. Provide financial insights for strategic decision-making. Collaboration and Leadership: Work with cross-functional teams to drive financial performance. Participate in strategic projects and initiatives. Business Partnering and Control: Actively support the expansion of supply chain business partnering by driving performance through activity and KPI steering. Develop and further enhance our integrated control concept. Participate in the optimization and digitalization of reporting. Monitor and analyze reports, evaluating strategic and operational targets. Develop and introduce recommendations proactively to management. Qualifications: Qualified CA/CMA/CIMA/MBA or equivalent professional degree. 3-6 years of experience in business partnering & controlling in supply chain, sourcing, commercial, or functional controlling. Understanding of controlling as a driving force of corporate management. Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel, and ideally SAP (SAP FI/CO, SAP MM). Experience with new technologies and digitization, ideally with SAC, BW, or Celonis. Strong analytical thinking, solution-oriented approach, and customer orientation
column11: Supply Chain Controlling, Controlling, Financial Control
